data.title: The Winners of MMFF's Gabi ng Parangal 2023
data.meta_description: The MMFF released its list of awardees for its 2023 rendition with the inclusion of 10 candidates to its stage, compared to its previous eight.
data.text:
The Metro Manila Film Festival (MMFF) returns in 2023 through a broader light, welcoming 10 entries into its prestigious roster. Diverting from the event’s annual eight, the committee announced the addition of six additional entrants in the second wave of evaluations last October 2023, with the fourth, fifth, and sixth placers accumulating a tied score of 93.3 percent.

Quezon City’s New Frontier Theatre hosted the awaited Gabi ng Parangal (Awards Night) last December 27, 2023, two days after the festival’s opening. Among MMFF’s 2023 candidates, “GomBurZa” racked up the most wins, securing seven awards under the wing of Best Director Pepe Diokno and Best Actor Cedrick Juan.

MMFF recognized “Firefly” as its Best Picture, noting its resounding screenplay and the academy’s Best Child Performer, Euwenn Mikaell. Rado Peru and Rommel Penesa’s “When I Met You in Tokyo” and Roderick Cabrido’s “Mallari” took home four awards a piece. “Becky & Badette” (2), “K(Ampon)” (1), and “Family of Two” (1) were other notable productions, rounding up the ceremony’s 2023 victors.

Here is the full list of winners of the 2023 MMFF:

Best Float: When I Met You in Tokyo

Best Child Performer: Euwenn Mikaell, Firefly

Best Sound: Melvin Q. Rivera and Louie Boy Bauson, GomBurZa

Best Score: Von de Guzman, Mallari

Best Original Theme Song: “Finggah Lickin,” Becky & Badette

Best Visual Effects: Gaspar Mangarin, Mallari

Best Production Design: Ericson Navarro, GomBurZa

Best Editing: Benjamin Tolentino, K(Ampon)

Best Cinematography: Carlo Canlas Mendoza, GomBurZa

Gender Sensitivity: Becky & Badette

Marichu Vera-Perez Maceda Memorial Award: Lily Monteverde

Gatpuno Antonio Villegas Cultural Award: GomBurZa

Fernando Poe Jr. Memorial Award for Excellence: When I Met You in Tokyo

Best Screenplay: Angeli Atienza, Firefly

Best Director: Pepe Diokno, GomBurZa

Best Supporting Actress: Miles Ocampo, Family of Two

Best Supporting Actor: JC Santos, Mallari

Best Actor: Cedrick Juan, GomBurZa

Best Actress: Vilma Santos, When I Met You in Tokyo

4th Best Picture: When I Met You in Tokyo

3rd Best Picture: Mallari

2nd Best Picture: GomBurZa

Best Picture: Firefly

The MMFF reported an increase in ticket sales compared to the previous year. While exact sales remain undisclosed, Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) chairman and concurrent MMFF chairman Don Artes motioned his approval for this year’s rendition, mentioning that “all 10-film entries are quality and impressive.”
